title: Apple Silicon M1 - libLLVMX86Disassembler.a: file too small to be an archive

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

labels.name: O-AArch64
labels.description: Armv8-A or later processors in AArch64 mode

body:
On a `Mac mini (M1, 2020)` with macOS Big Sur `11.2 (20D64)`

running a `./x.py build` and letting it compile llvm from scratch results in:
```
error: failed to add native library /Users/walther/git/rust/build/aarch64-apple-darwin/llvm/build/lib/libLLVMX86Disassembler.a: file too small to be an archive

error: aborting due to previous error

error: could not compile `rustc_llvm`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
command did not execute successfully: "/Users/walther/git/rust/build/aarch64-apple-darwin/stage0/bin/cargo" "build" "--target" "aarch64-apple-darwin" "-Zbinary-dep-depinfo" "-j" "8" "--release" "--features" " llvm max_level_info" "--manifest-path" "/Users/walther/git/rust/compiler/rustc/Cargo.toml" "--message-format" "json-render-diagnostics"
expected success, got: exit code: 101
failed to run: /Users/walther/git/rust/build/bootstrap/debug/bootstrap build
```

Note, that `llvm` compilation itself seemed to complete successfully before it:

```
...
-- Installing: /Users/walther/git/rust/build/aarch64-apple-darwin/llvm/lib/cmake/llvm/./CheckLinkerFlag.cmake
cargo:root=/Users/walther/git/rust/build/aarch64-apple-darwin/llvm
        finished in 1726.572 seconds
Building stage0 compiler artifacts (aarch64-apple-darwin -> aarch64-apple-darwin)
...
```

The file in question seems to be `3.2M` in size. I do not know if that is indeed too small to be correct, or if there is some unknown error in detecting it.

```
ls -halF /Users/walther/git/rust/build/aarch64-apple-darwin/llvm/build/lib/libLLVMX86Disassembler.a
-rw-r--r--  1 walther  staff   3.2M Feb  5 16:02 /Users/walther/git/rust/build/aarch64-apple-darwin/llvm/build/lib/libLLVMX86Disassembler.a
```

This was ran at `rust` repository commit hash `9e5d58fb420a487ae30f38141eccdc8d79fb8d58`.

Note, I did not attempt to do any cross-compilation - this was simply cloning the repository and running `./x.py build`, with the expectation to build against the native `aarch64` target.
